intro: Teucrium capitatum subsp. gussonii, commonly known as the coastal germander, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features narrow, aromatic leaves and produces small, clustered blue or violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
